fields.name: Corrective procedure
fields.description:
This term covers:
- Brief induction and maintenance of general/local/regional anaesthesia by use of agents and by routes suitable for the species, nature and duration of the procedure - Inhalation.
- Administration of substances topically to the skin or conjunctiva with anaesthesia.
- Placement of head in atraumatic headholder  (via atraumatic ear and eye bars) (optional)

fields.name: Water restriction
fields.description: - Variation in the composition, constituents, quantity and/or availability of the diet and/or drinking water which may cause pain, suffering, distress or lasting harm - withholding of water

fields.name: UV cement
fields.description: - Exposure to ionising and/or non-ionising radiation.

fields.name: Ephys recording with chronic probe(s)
fields.description:
- Head bolt clamp to a fixation bar (head bolt already in place and fully healed)
- Non-Invasive sensory stimulation without anaesthesia

fields.name: Ephys recording with acute probe(s)
fields.description:
- Head bolt clamp to a fixation bar (head bolt already in place and fully healed)
- Non-surgical placement or removal of electrodes, probes or other devices that may cause pain, suffering, distress or lasting harm.
- Non-Invasive sensory stimulation without anaesthesia

fields.name: Clear skull cap
fields.description:
This surgery involves incision of skin and connective tissue across the skull, disconnection of posterior muscle, and implantation of a headplate on the cerebellar bone, followed by the application of anoptical adhesive (NOA 61 or 81), cured with a UV gun.
The clear skull cap may also involve attachment of a 3D printed light guide around the cleared skull area.

fields.name: fUSi window
fields.description: Headplate implant + large craniotomy (4.5mm x 9mm) + PMP window implant.

fields.name: Coverslip implant
fields.description:
This term covers:
- Induction and maintenance of general/local/regional anaesthesia by use of agents and by routes suitable for the species, nature and duration of the procedure - Inhalation.
- Subcutaneous injection under anesthesia
- Intramuscular injection under anesthesia
- Administration of substances topically to the skin or conjunctiva with anaesthesia.
- Placement of head in atraumatic headholder  (via atraumatic ear and eye bars)
- Craniotomy
- Implantation of head fixation device and/or recording chamber, including coverslip.

fields.name: Imaging
fields.description:
- Head bolt clamp to a fixation bar (head bolt already in place and fully healed)
- Non-Invasive sensory stimulation without anaesthesia
- Exposure to ionising and/or non-ionising radiation.
- Non invasive imaging. without anaesthesia

fields.name: Headplate implant
fields.description:
This term covers:
- Induction and maintenance of general/local/regional anaesthesia by use of agents and by routes suitable for the species, nature and duration of the procedure - Inhalation.
- Subcutaneous injection under anesthesia
- Intramuscular injection under anesthesia
- Administration of substances topically to the skin or conjunctiva with anaesthesia.
- A small area of animal skin is shaved
- Placement in sterotaxic frame whilst under anaesthesia
- Placement of head in atraumatic headholder  (via atraumatic ear and eye bars)
- Implantation of head fixation device and/or recording chamber.

fields.name: Skull thinning
fields.description:
This term covers:
- Induction and maintenance of general/local/regional anaesthesia by use of agents and by routes suitable for the species, nature and duration of the procedure - Inhalation.
- Subcutaneous injection under anesthesia
- Intramuscular injection under anesthesia
- Administration of substances topically to the skin or conjunctiva with anaesthesia.
- A small area of animal skin is shaved
- Placement of head in atraumatic headholder  (via atraumatic ear and eye bars)
- Skull thinning

fields.name: Intraocular injection
fields.description:
This term covers:
- Induction and maintenance of general/local/regional anaesthesia by use of agents and by routes suitable for the species, nature and duration of the procedure - Inhalation.
- Subcutaneous injection under anesthesia
- Intramuscular injection under anesthesia
- Administration of substances topically to the skin or conjunctiva with anaesthesia.
- Administration of substances by Intraocular injection

fields.name: Optical stimulation
fields.description: - Exposure to ionising and/or non-ionising radiation.

fields.name: Optical-fiber implant
fields.description:
This term covers:
- Induction and maintenance of general/local/regional anaesthesia by use of agents and by routes suitable for the species, nature and duration of the procedure - Inhalation.
- Subcutaneous injection under anesthesia
- Intramuscular injection under anesthesia
- Administration of substances topically to the skin or conjunctiva with anaesthesia.
- Placement of head in atraumatic headholder  (via atraumatic ear and eye bars)
- Craniotomy
- Implantation of optical fiber

fields.name: Secondary craniotomy/durotomy
fields.description:
This refers to craniotomy performed close to/on the day of recording, mostly for Ephys recording.

- Induction and maintenance of general/local/regional anaesthesia by use of agents and by routes suitable for the species, nature and duration of the procedure - Inhalation.
- Subcutaneous injection under anesthesia
- Administration of substances topically to the skin or conjunctiva with anaesthesia.
- Craniotomy

fields.name: Coverslip replacement
fields.description:
This term covers:
- Induction and maintenance of general/local/regional anaesthesia by use of agents and by routes suitable for the species, nature and duration of the procedure - Inhalation.
- Subcutaneous injection under anesthesia
- Intramuscular injection under anesthesia
- Administration of substances topically to the skin or conjunctiva with anaesthesia.
- Placement of head in atraumatic headholder  (via atraumatic ear and eye bars)
- Maintenance of head recording chamber including adjustments of probes,guide tubes and the cleaning of implantation site.
- Durotomy

fields.name: Virus injection
fields.description:
This term covers:
- Induction and maintenance of general/local/regional anaesthesia by use of agents and by routes suitable for the species, nature and duration of the procedure - Inhalation.
- Subcutaneous injection under anesthesia
- Intramuscular injection under anesthesia
- Administration of substances topically to the skin or conjunctiva with anaesthesia.
- Placement of head in atraumatic headholder  (via atraumatic ear and eye bars)
- Craniotomy
- Intracranial injection of substances with anaesthesia
- Administration of substances into neural structures by injection and with anaesthesia.

fields.name: Neuromics
fields.description: Any Neuromics related procedures including perfusions, bead injections etc.

fields.name: Behavior training/tasks
fields.description:
- Head bolt clamp to a fixation bar (head bolt already in place and fully healed)
- Training and performance of psychophysical visual tasks via the use of rewards

fields.name: Brain lesion
fields.description: - Lesioning of discrete areas of the central nervous system by chemical, thermal or physical means.

fields.name: Tail Vein Injection
fields.description: To be performed without anaesthesia by a trained personnel (Angela from BSU is the trained and competent person to perform this for us).

fields.name: Head-fixation only
fields.description: - Head bolt clamp to a fixation bar (head bolt already in place and fully healed)

fields.name: Single-cell electroporation
fields.description:
This term covers:
- Induction and maintenance of general/local/regional anaesthesia by use of agents and by routes suitable for the species, nature and duration of the procedure - Inhalation.
- Subcutaneous injection under anesthesia
- Administration of substances topically to the skin or conjunctiva with anaesthesia.
- Intracranial injection of substances with anaesthesia
- Administration of substances into neural structures by injection and with anaesthesia.

fields.name: Histology
fields.description: Covers the acquisition of histological sections, the subsequent registration of slices to a common reference atlas and the eventual recovery of electrophysiology tracks through manual picking.

fields.name: Cannula implant
fields.description:
This term covers:
- Induction and maintenance of general/local/regional anaesthesia by use of agents and by routes suitable for the species, nature and duration of the procedure - Inhalation.
- Subcutaneous injection under anesthesia
- Intramuscular injection under anesthesia
- Administration of substances topically to the skin or conjunctiva with anaesthesia.
- Placement of head in atraumatic headholder  (via atraumatic ear and eye bars) OR Head bolt clamp to a fixation bar (head bolt already in place and fully healed)
- Craniotomy
- Implantation of cannula
